data.title: How disruptive tech is reshaping the financial services industry
data.description: Swatee Singh looks at how the financial services industry is using AI, ML, mixed reality and other technologies.

data.title: Recent trends in data and ML
data.description: Ben Lorica dives into emerging technologies for building data infrastructures and machine learning platforms.

data.title: Unleash the power of data at scale
data.description: Jeremy Rader explores Intel’s end-to-end data pipeline software strategy.

data.title: Everything is connected and the clock is ticking
data.description: Sara Menker and Nemo Semret outline the complex and interconnected factors that shape the agriculture industry.

data.title: Cisco Data Intelligence Platform
data.description: Siva Sivakumar explains how the Cisco Data Intelligence Platform brings together data, AI, compute, and storage.

data.title: Safe and smarter driving, powered by AI
data.description: Lei Pan explores how Nauto uses AWS to continually evolve smarter data for driver behavior.

data.title: On gradient-based methods for finding game-theoretic equilibria
data.description: Michael Jordan details several recent results that blend gradient-based methodology with game-theoretic goals.

data.title: Accelerate with purpose
data.description: Ananth Sankaranarayanan discusses three three key shifts in the AI landscape, how to navigate them, and when to explore hardware acceleration.

data.title: Practical insights into deep reinforcement learning
data.description: Sahika Genc dives deep into state-of-the-art techniques in deep reinforcement learning for a variety of use cases.

data.title: Open-endedness: A new grand challenge for AI
data.description: Kenneth Stanley discusses how open-ended algorithms can offer an entirely different level of automated creation.

data.title: Understanding deep neural networks
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Michael Mahoney on developing a practical theory for deep learning.

data.title: AI for ophthalmology: Doing what doctors can’t
data.description: Daniel Russakoff discusses how AI is being used to predict age-related macular degeneration progression.

data.title: Enabling AI’s potential through wafer-scale integration
data.description: Andrew Feldman discusses the Wafer Scale Engine, the largest chip ever built.

data.title: Getting from A to AI
data.description: Eric Gardner shares a four-step journey that all kinds of organizations can use to evaluate their unique paths from data to insights.

data.title: O'Reilly AI Conference keynote highlights
data.description: Experts discuss new trends, tools, and issues in artificial intelligence and machine learning.

data.title: Going beyond fully supervised learning
data.description: Srinivas Narayanan takes a deep look into the next change we’re seeing in AI—going beyond fully supervised learning techniques.

data.title: Developing AI responsibly
data.description: Sarah Bird discusses the major challenges of responsible AI development and examines promising new tools and technologies to help enable it in practice.

data.title: Unlocking the value of your data
data.description: Dinesh Nirmal examines how organizations can unlock the value of their data for AI with a unified, prescriptive information architecture.

data.title: Topics to watch at Strata NY '19
data.description: Machine learning, artificial intelligence, data engineering, and architecture are driving the data space.

data.title: How new data and AI tools are being used in health care
data.description: An overview of applications of new tools for overcoming silos, and for creating and sharing high-quality data.

data.title: ML needs different deployment
data.description: As organizations embrace machine learning, the need for new deployment tools and strategies grows.

data.title: Becoming a machine learning practitioner
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Kesha Williams on how she added machine learning to her software developer toolkit.

data.title: Organizations are sharpening their AI skills
data.description: To successfully implement AI technologies, companies need to take a holistic approach toward retraining their workforces.

data.title: Labeling, transforming, and structuring training data sets for machine learning
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Alex Ratner on how to build and manage training data with Snorkel.

data.title: Guidelines for building voice applications
data.description: Speech adds another level of complexity to AI applications—today’s voice applications provide a very early glimpse of what is to come.

data.title: Make data science more useful
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Cassie Kozyrkov on connecting data and AI to business.

data.title: Learning from adversaries
data.description: Adversarial images aren’t a problem—they’re an opportunity to explore new ways of interacting with AI.

data.title: Acquiring and sharing high-quality data
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Roger Chen on the fair value and decentralized governance of data.

data.title: Managing machine learning in the enterprise: Lessons from banking and health care
data.authors: Ben Lorica, Harish Doddi, David Talby
data.description: A look at how guidelines from regulated industries can help shape your ML strategy.

data.title: The circle of fairness
data.description: We shouldn't ask our AI tools to be fair; instead, we should ask them to be less unfair and be willing to iterate until we see improvement.
